website_summaries.verdict: Many reviewers said they liked this bed while it lasted, but frequent inner chamber seal ruptures leave it looking like a beach ball before too long.
pros: Built-in electric pump inflates mattress in just under five minutes
Waterproof flocked top with vinyl beams and sturdy construction
Indented sides keep your fitted sheets from slipping
Duffel bag included for easy storage and transport
cons: Bed can be damaged by leaving in the sun
Inner chamber seals can rupture, leaving parts of the bed lumpy and over-inflated

customer_reviews.title: Now a beach ball
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but poor quality. The chambers continue to break; the bed is now a giant beach ball after 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy if you want it long term
customer_reviews.text: It will not stay even. Within two months , I noticed a large air bubble on the right side of the bed! It’s a good concept but it won’t stay even. I’m only 140lns and my son is like 43 and often lays in it. Then I left home for two days and found it deflatOmg! Disappointed but good if you only plan to use it a few times over the course of the year I suppose or for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Quash

customer_reviews.title: Read this before purchasing!
customer_reviews.text: This air bed is horrible. After only 5 uses 3 of the seams simply popped allowing more air to fill that side while the other side remains low. A sub-par air bed!!! My rating is half or no star but that wasn't an option.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: The good and bad of this bed
customer_reviews.text: First let me say the company is great and worked with me to refund my money after the bed started to come apart within the first month of owning it. The bevels are sealed top to bottom and one came lose which caused a big bulge in the mattress needless to say this made it unusable. I've owned 2 other mattress just like this and the also had the same problem. Even though it's a good price it doesn't last long, but then again if you are only going to be using it for a few weeks or nights as a guess bed it's cheaper then a hotel and the bed was very comfortable until it blow the seam.
customer_reviews.author: sunlicks

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after several uses--do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this airbed a few months ago for family visiting over the holidays. My 115 pound mother slept on it for a total of 8 days and it has not been used since then. I went to inflate the mattrress yesterday for another visitor, and it has a terrible leak! It could not last throughout the whole night without almost completely deflating. I am extrememly disappointed in this airbed, and Intex is not willing to provide a replacement. This was a complete waste of money--only got 8 good uses out of it.
customer_reviews.author: SimpleIntellect

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this one...doesn't last! Update
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 2 months ago and only used twice before the wall in one of the top air chambers let go. Now there's a huge balloon that runs down the center and my Amazon return "window" has closed! I wouldn't buy this since I see other reviewers have had the same problem. *Update 4/25/17: Contacted Intex & they replaced the defective airbed with another one. Unfortunately this one is also defective & doesn't stay inflated! Intex will not replace again or refund purchase price unless I return this second defective one (for $20!). My experience is that this is a horrible air bed & Intex has horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie H

customer_reviews.title: Back never felt so GOOD after the first several uses
customer_reviews.text: Lasted at least 4-weeks. Arrived sooner than expected, considering the holidays when I placed the order. Arrived on Christmas Eve ('16), a Saturday. We inflated it. Wanted something to use when the husband and I would camp out in the living room. Back never felt so GOOD after the first several uses. Unfortunately, it took a dive this past Tuesday (January10th, 2017). There was a sudden pop and I groaned inwardly. And sure enough, as others have said, a seam broke on the left side of the bed (well, left side of the air pump). For the price, I guess we paid for what we got, but with the shipping included, I expected more. Ah, live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Air Bed
customer_reviews.text: Got this bed delivered in just a few days. I set it up and it was really easy to do. Take it out of the package, plug the built in inflator/deflator in to 110/120V receptacle and it will self inflate in about 5 or 6 minutes. Well made, looks like I will get a lot of use out of it. I am a BIG Guy...and my Wife is a Small woman...she does not roll to the middle when I get on the Airbed. Well made, top quality, worth the price. It does take a few days of "airing out" to ride it of the "plastic smell".
customer_reviews.author: C. Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Avoid unless you like sleeping in a padded air canoe.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because we have friends that stay the night from time to time and wanted something comfortable for them to sleep on. Finally had friends stay with us and woke up to them having to reair the mattress in the middle of the night. They were mostly deflated. They even tightened the air seal the second time and put some duct tape over it. They woke up in the morning to a completely deflated mattress. So embarrassing. We did the spray bottle with soap trick to find out that the motor itself was not sealed properly into the mattress and leaked. 50 dollars down the drain. Avoid this product since they can't even seal the motor in properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice mattress for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these in the past for extra guests and camping. I like to have 2 on hand. I just replaced one after 4 years of very occasional use - maybe just 2-3 times a year. Probably something that happened during camping. Can't find the leak. However very easy to inflate and deflate. The bag it comes in is way too small in my opinion. It is very difficult to get it folded up to fit back in the bag. For the price it is a good buy. Couldn't see paying $100 or more for just occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Davis

customer_reviews.title: I have a bad back and tend to be extremely picky when it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a weekend trip and was shocked at how tall the mattress blows up to be. I have a bad back and tend to be extremely picky when it comes to beds. However, I slept very well on this mattress and was impressed with how well the air stayed in it over night. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin B

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Still haven't figured out how to stop it from losing air every few days but absolutely love the height, the comfort and the lack of smell of the material. It's quite easy to set up and great for the price. Used for the Holidays with two adults sleeping on it comfortably. Have to ask the best way to put it back in the box so I am certain it works with the interior structure instead of against it but absolutely enjoyed using it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat E.

customer_reviews.title: Bulging in the middle
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed because this is was a very comfortable mattress while it lasted, but have had the same problem as many people, two of the seams that create the air chambers running lengthwise down the bed have given way and now there a giant 2 foot wide bulge on one half of the bed. See many of the review photos to see what I mean. I prefer a softer mattress feel so I know I didnt over inflate. Only one adult sleeping on the bed so this shouldnt happen. Outside the Amazon return date by one week, will call Intex to see if they will do something for us.
customer_reviews.author: Gonflyn

customer_reviews.title: Stop- don't even consider it
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this bed for a little under two months before it started leaking air. I'd pump up the mattress and within ten minutes, most of the air is gone and I find myself sinking into it. Searched for a hole but there is none- it's just defective. Company suggested I soak the mattress in water so I can find the leak. really? It only insures for 30 days so keep that in mind too. The fact that it gives you a bunch of patches to plug up holes should have clued me in that this bed is of low quality and company expects you to have issues with it. I wouldn't recommend this mattress to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Next best thing to a bed!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent airbed! This sits so high and is extremely comfortable for when I have guests over. If I went camping, I would be so happy to take this airbed with me! I have been the unfortunate guest who has to sleep on the crummy air mattresses of my friends' in the past, but this one is heaven in comparison to the others. Also an added bonus-- it will not deflate on you in the middle of the night, leaving you on the hardwood floor wondering where you went wrong in life :P
customer_reviews.author: mnicole

customer_reviews.title: Like all airbeds......they eventually leak......
customer_reviews.text: Like all airbeds......they eventually leak...... I have bought at least 10 airbeds over the years, some last a few weeks, and some actually last for about 6 months, but they all spring leaks. Better to buy a regular mattress unless you are camping or something? I suppose if you had kids on them you could eek out more lifespan of these things. They are comfy right up until they start leaking air, then they are basically junk...
customer_reviews.author: Wild Dog Knives

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but they lose air by morning after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy bed. Self inflation and auto deflation. Update...I recieved it in Sept. 2017 No complaints till November 2017 it would not in flate as firm as it used to. Now December 2017 the middle seems have become one big long bump down the middle & it does not retain its air all night. Even reinflating during the night. Does not inflate evenly either. Just looked, and my return deadline was October. Figures one month before. Uh....I have yet to find a air mattress that retains its air all night till morning. Previous pirchase to this one, had a hole after 3 -4 mos use. They are comfy, but not for long. Still hopeful to find a good one.
customer_reviews.author: mob

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 8 Years
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bed for my spare bedroom In 2012. Used it for guests and visiting family. Like the 22 inch height. Like the built-in air pump. Like that I can put regular sheets on it but I’ve put a foam topper on it first to create a more flat surface and to block the cold air from the mattress. Brought it to my mothers house to help dad recover from cancer. He likes the adjustable aspect to it and weighs 175 lbs. In January 2020, one side of it ruptured while sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, invalid warranty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mattress and immediately had issues with staying inflated. I returned under the 30 day return window and was sent a replacement. This one stayed inflated a little bit longer, so I figured it was just a sub-stellar product. Well, I recently stayed on my sister's identical brand and model number, except purchased through an authorized retailer, and it stayed inflated for 4 days straight! I'd never had mine stay inflated more than one night at a time! Upon reviewing the warranty information, I discovered that Amazon is not an authorized retailer, so the warranty is invalid. And of course, Amazon only stands behind it for 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: On a cloud.
customer_reviews.text: Feels great. I sleep on a 2 1/2 inch topper on top of this mattress and it feels great. The reason I got a 22inch is that it's easier to get out of bed. This mattress does need to be inflated a couple of times as it does tend to settle more than the previous mattress that I had. All and all I would buy again. Eventually I will buy a "regular" mattress but for the price of this mattress I can save my money to get the mattress I want.
customer_reviews.author: Walter H.

customer_reviews.title: Get a different one
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for less than 2 months and have only used it 3 times and it already leaks. I assume it is around the internal pump seam as there are no visible holes. It leaks slowly overnight and you wake with it half deflated. Very disappointed and also disappointed that I cannot return or exchange it. Next time I will buy one WIHTOUT the internal pump in hopes it will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: coco

customer_reviews.title: loved it.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great air mattress for the price. It is an air mattress.... so it's not a luxury down comforter, 10" pillow top Cali King bed. For what it is, its perfect. its great quality, raises really high, build in pump is amazing, Great for camping, or for company coming over with a quick notice. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: TrishTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy about overall performance
customer_reviews.text: Served its purpose as a display only. Started leaking air after the first week. As no one was actually sleeping on it, we were using it as a display while our house was for sale...so only had to add air every few days...did what we wanted. But would have been nice to keep for future guests. Unfortunately the leak just got worse and eventually had to add air every day. Thank goodness it did not cost much.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't stay inflated. I filled it up with air in the afternoon and let it sit over night. Didn't sleep on it. Following morning it was half deflated. I figured I may have done something wrong, so I re-inflated it and again, after half a day it was deflated. They put a warning in the package saying any warranty claim or dispute is going to be judged by an arbitration party (or something similar), and that all their products have passed the most rigorous Quality Assurance testing. What a joke! Returned like a hot potato!
customer_reviews.author: Andrei G.

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just like any air bed they tend to sink in a little once you lie down on them. My advice is to fully inflate the mattress and wait 30 min before adding more air to ensure it is fully inflated. When filling the air the air entering may warm up a little due to the motor/built in pump and then cool after being in contact with a tile floor making the bed appear to deflate a little. I purchased these mattresses after giving away the original one I had for two years ago.
customer_reviews.author: JOE R.

customer_reviews.title: Don't know if you'll find a better deal on self inflateable air mattreses anywhere!!!
customer_reviews.text: I believe these cost $90, I Bought them 5 years ago. they self inflate quickly, not noisy while inflating. just plug into wall push a button and watch it inflate. Very tough, sometimes I have to yell at the kids for jumping on them but they've never had a leak although they definitely come with patch kits. Very durable beds. very quick to deflate to. queen mattress, very big and very comfortable. sits at a decent height.best air mattress I've bought in at least 4 years. I highly recommend this for adults and kids. GREAT BUY, IF YOU NEED AN AIRMATTRESS LOOK NO FURTHER!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Rich

customer_reviews.title: Never buying INTEX again!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd, I repeat 3rd air mattress I have purchased from INTEX that become useless junk. I should have learned my lesson! Each one I bought was not usable after 2 uses camping. This latest one I bought in May off of Amazon. I used it once camping. We were very careful with it. It lasted the whole weekend no issues. Stored it well/properly. I went to use it last month for camping, it lost air all weekend. Sadly it is past the return window. Go with a different brand! Pay the extra money for better quality!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use in an apartment while shopping for a new house. Surprisingly comfortable, and good quality. Four months on, however, it looks as though some internal seams have let go, so the visible contours in the top surface have changed. Basically, some of the tube-like sections are now twice as wide as when new, since they seem no longer anchored internally. It does change the feeling of the mattress, but does not result in leaks or other loss of function. For the price, I have not seen a better alternative.
customer_reviews.author: William Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Regret this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an airbed that was raised so it was easier to get in and out of for guests. This looks great when you blow it up and was very happy with it! However, it leaks air. Doesn't matter how the nozzle is turned, it still slowly leaks air through the night until it is about half-full. With it being raised, this is troublesome because the lighter person is going to end up falling onto the heavier person (because they sink down in it more). Originally thought it was well worth the money, but not now. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Greta B.

customer_reviews.title: Deflates way too much
customer_reviews.text: 1st time I used this it deflated a little.. No problem, I read that it might and probably will do this to settle. 2nd time had same problem. 3rd time it deflated so much overnight you couldn't even sleep on it. So my grandson and I finally got out of the deflated mess and I pumped it up again and 15 minutes later its deflated down again. I used all 3 times indoors and swept the floors before putting the bed down. This is not good. I will not buy this again
customer_reviews.author: keneo

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for a queen, maybe her runt sister.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok so far. It's definitely not queen size, unless air mattress sizes gauge smaller than regular mattresses. I like that you can increase the air pressure to where it's quite firm, or let a little out and have something more soft. No seams ripping or bulging yet. Deflates to a very compact size. Electric pump appreciated as I would probably have a heart attack trying to blow this sucker up. **Update quick note** If it's chilly where you are, be sure to pad the mattress well, otherwise it feels like you're sleeping without any covers on.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Moved across the country and didn't bring anything that didn't fit in my car so I needed a new bed until I find a more permanent mattress. This airbed blows up really fast, and stays inflated. It is really comfortable. My only complaint would be that I think I got an odd sewing job because I sleep in the middle and yet there is a definite lean that causes me to end up sleeping on the right side (like a bed gets after sleeping in the same spot for years). It isn't the end of the world, it is just strange. Very happy with this airbed and would recommend it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Ceranic

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be ware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for extra bed at lake house. Leaked first time used one night thought maybe not inflated enough. Did not use again until this summer same problem. Used twice over holiday weekends and alot of leaking air each night. Very dissatisfied as had purchased this brand of air mattress several years ago and it was great. Not going to buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Zog

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I'm Not at all happy with this purchase. I bought this in 4-2016, we took it out 3 times for 3 different house guest, and it has a slow leak. I can't find it. I'm bummed. It has not been abuse or over filled or whatever, it was set up and put away between each use, and used by 3 adults, for 3 nights. That stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl McKay

customer_reviews.title: If they had negative stars as an option, it ...
customer_reviews.text: If they had negative stars as an option, it would be my choice. My husband refuses to sleep on the bed because it sags in the middle, I have been on hold with Intex for nearly an hour to find out if it can be overinflated and explode. I guess I'll just let it run and Amazon (a 10-star company) will refund my money because it's still brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Exploding Seams.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Was 5 star at first, for comfort and how easy it was to set up. However, I purchased this bed back in March. Now, two months later we blew up the bed and the center section blew up much larger than the other sections. I thought perhaps it would level out, but I was wrong. When my guest went to lay down, there was a very large pop sound and a hole exploded at the seam of the bed. For the price, it was great at first, but if you intend to use more than once or twice this bed may literally fall apart at the seams.
customer_reviews.author: InJenUity

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BED HAS SHORT PRODUCT LIFE.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Intex queen bed and on both of them after 4-6 months of intermittent guest usage one of the air tube seams has separated and left a large hump in the middle of the bed - rendering it in useable. We like the product, as do our guests, but the short life of the product puts a damper on it and has me looking for a replacement PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but short and small
customer_reviews.text: This bed is very small compared to the other beds I had gotten from this company and low to the floor. When I set it up it dipped really bad in the middle as if I had been sleeping on it for days when I hadn't even laid on it yet. Its a comfortable air mattress but I'm returning it due to the dip in the middle and the small size. Suppose to be a queen but it looks and feels like a full
customer_reviews.author: ALEXX

customer_reviews.title: Leaks out of the box
customer_reviews.text: After inflating, it loses air to the point that it need re-inflating several times a night. The instructions warn that this will happen the first two nights from vinyl stretching, but after four nights, it's still down several inches after 3-4 hours, even without anyone on it. Unfortunately, I waited too long to open the package, and can no longer return it for replacement. Potentially a good product, but be sure to inflate it when you receive it to make sure you haven't also received a defective unit. Guess I'll look for a more expensive, hopefully more reliable airbed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer James Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Junk not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. Did not last long. I got 3 or 4 uses and it was always leaking down. I bought a beautyrest. It is great and it vacuums the air out unlike the intex which has to be rolled and layed on multiple times and it still wont fit in the bag that comes with it! 2 stars only because of Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: SherriC1978

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, had an issue with mine but sure ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, had an issue with mine but sure it was a defect that can happen with many products. Got a replacement since I'd only had a couple day, but I also bought the smaller one and they are amazing, comfortable and will use them for a long time. Love the pump being made in, very easy to access and quick to set up. Must have product.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for kids! We bought this for the kids to use when they have friends stay over. We had never purchased an airbed before that had the built-in inflate feature. Boy, am I glad we finally did! We had this out of the box and blown up in no time. Easy enough for the older kids (9 and 10) to do without help. The kids said they slept comfortably, and the mattress did not seem to lose much air during the night (2 kids sleeping on it, each about 65lbs). Have not had any adults try it out yet, so not sure how it will hold up during a full night with more weight on it.
customer_reviews.author: lil_mrs_outspoken

customer_reviews.title: Probably won’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 8 months now and only used it maybe 2-3 times. I’m using it right now and it deflates. I guess storing it for a while will impact it’s performance because I barely use it and after 30 mins I’m sinking in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: great air mattress
customer_reviews.text: great air mattress has been in use now 5 times by 4 different people. all found it comfortable and better than what they would expect from a air mattress. fast inflation with the pump that comes with it. overall very happy. was just going to be a one use item but turned out to be a long time keeper.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Defective, Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product IN APRIL 2018 for guests who were arriving in September. After the 3rd use the seams started to pop and now there is a big air bubble in the middle of the mattress and its completely unusable. Mind you it was uncomfortable as all heck. Will not recommend or purchase this product again. wILL STICK TO THE ORIGINAL BRAND
customer_reviews.author: Yurs

customer_reviews.title: ZERO issues used everyday for weeks!
customer_reviews.text: We love this blow up bed!! We had company and set them up with it for two nights in the living room and it was perfect. My 6 year old loved having it up so we left it up for 3 weeks longer. She used it as a gymnastics pad and ran and did flips onto it for days!! We used it every night just to watch tv and even has some "campouts" on it. The inflater/deflater work quickly and works very well. There is a storage for the cord and plug in and the height is perfect. We would have left it up if I didn't just want my living room floor back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mattress!
customer_reviews.text: This airbed performed excellently on a recent visit we made to our in-laws house. It was very confortable, kept the air pressure throughout the night, had no plastic smell as some of this mattresses do, the inflation motor did the job fast and was reasonably silent, much more than a hair dryer for example. My in-laws were more than happy to keep it as a gift from us when we left. I am sure it will give many months of great service! Very pleased, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: G. Sibaja

customer_reviews.title: Awful air mattress
customer_reviews.text: This product is awful.I recently relocated to a different state and decided to purchase this air mattress for my bedroom as a temporary fix until I received my mattress. I received the intex raised down airbedvon 9/08/17. Today is 9/14/17 and I have inflated it everyday since I have received it. The instructions says, the mattress is stretching and not deflating. But every night I sleep on it I wake up like a hot dog wrapped in a bun. This is absolutely awful. I was really hoping this would do well especially when I purchased the smaller one for my child and it seems to be ok. If possible I will be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what is going on with the mattress but the middle part sinks in while the rest of it is kind of normal. Yesterday I deflated it and inflated the mattress again the issue remained. I also noticed that the left side was extra swollen even though I deflated it a bit. Its a very unusual mattress and I don't think I will be using their product again. For better quality product I'll just have to spend more money.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: one of the worst air bed I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: one of the worst air bed I have ever purchased. please dont waste your money on this one. Where do i start? When I pumped it up, theres a sinking area in the middle no matter how much i pump it up. I have the worst backaches sleeping on this thing. Update: after only 2 weeks, one side blew out while my daughter and I were on it. I weight 120, my daughter 21 lbs. They need to stop making these beds.
customer_reviews.author: T4mm1

customer_reviews.title: Love IT!
customer_reviews.text: Strangely researched many air mattresses because my boyfriend is 6'4" and hates when his feet are way of the edge. also we made the mistake of forgetting a pump a couple times camping and this was the perfect solution for both. If his feet hang off slightly he barely notices because it is so tall and it self inflates and deflates with the flick of a switch which is amazing for efficiency and packing it back up! It sucks all the air out like a vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Worst airbed ever! I bought this a year ago and have only used it about 6 times. It worked fine the first three times. It now deflates after about 3 hours, and you have to fill it back up.
customer_reviews.author: V,.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this mattress, unless you like sleeping on the floor!
customer_reviews.text: My issue seems to be slightly different than others - just a classic leak, but it's along the seam so its not repairable. The 90-day warranty is really pretty absurd, too - if its for temporary use, who uses it more than a few times during a year! We used it twice, and literally on the second time it developed the leak. No low price is worth the hassle of a poorly manufactured product - even the built-in pump, which I considered a plus, is now unusable because it's attached to a leaky mattress!
customer_reviews.author: S Kamin

customer_reviews.title: Deflated easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it started deflating each use within the first 60 days. I had it replaced, and now the 2nd one completely deflates after only an hour or two. It’s only been used indoor, on carpet, and probably a handful of times in the last 9 months, and always properly stored. I cannot get it replaced or exchanged again at this point. The bed also seems to feel cold all the time while in use. We managed that by laying a fleece blanket on top before a fitted sheet. I will avoid this brand again from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Should It Last Longer?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 of these. One has yet to be opened. The 2 that were opened have been in use for about 10 weeks. They both have seams in the top that have split by the 8-week point, making the top surface uneven to sleep on. I don't know if it should be expected to last longer with ONE adult sleeping on each for two months, but that is how it has gone. There is NO WARRANTY (according to manufacturer) on the product and the 30-day replacement seems to only cover product incorrectly shipped or damaged on arrival. Maybe I am expecting too much for money spent, but 2 months just doesn't seem right to me.
customer_reviews.author: a.b

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy I chose this bed for when people are staying ...
customer_reviews.text: I've now had several people stay with me and sleep on this airbed. The pump is loud but it does the job. The next morning a bit more air must be put in for the next sleep but this may stop over time. When deflated it gets fairly small - considering getting it back into it's cover is a slight challenge compared to how it arrived! I'm very happy I chose this bed for when people are staying over. It doesn't move too much when turning over and it's fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: RBG

customer_reviews.title: Works well Good value
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for two years on and off and it works well for overnight guests. We have a single size we have been using for 5 or 6 years that we take to our lake cottage and I like the way it sleeps better than the bed. The electric pump works great. Keep the instruction for folding and it will go back into the carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Pumping them up is so easy. Just plug in and start
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these when I was having guests overnight and didn't have bedrooms for all of them. This mattress pumps up perfectly and after putting a little more air in before bedtime, the guests who slept on them remarked on how well they held up. Pumping them up is so easy. Just plug in and start; turn off when its full. Couldn't be easier. After using them, just turn the dial to deflate, and down it goes. I rolled both mattresses up and placed them back in their bag. All ready for next time. Service was fast; packaging was great. A satisfying buying experience all around.
customer_reviews.author: User1

customer_reviews.title: Has Taken A Beaten And i Is Still Sleepin’!
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, this is a somewhat short owned review but.. for sure have never slept on a more comfortable inflatable bed. I saw many reviews talked of popped bladders. Ours has endured the kids “bouncy house fun”, my 200lb stature along side my wife’s 100 lb daintiness and it continues to provide fine wakeless nights. At half the price of my first inclination, I can easily endorse and say we love our Mattress.
customer_reviews.author: T.  Catalano

customer_reviews.title: Great deal but heavy and some air loss in the night
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. This bad is Heavy! Not ideal for frequent trips up and down flights of stairs for storage. I can't imagine lugging this thing out for camping. I followed the instructions to a T, with allowing the bed to get to room temperature. Experience some air loss throughout the night with about 300lbs on it each night and the idea to just press the button to inflate it again to the firmness you'd like is absurd, unless a loud motor won't disturb you or your housemates... This bed is also huge, fine for 6'3" and definitely enough for two people who are larger.
customer_reviews.author: Jill_M.

customer_reviews.title: This review isn't full of air!
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but I felt that this was worth mentioning. I had looked at several of the reviews and saw some of the horror stories of the mess ups people received. For the price and the built in pump, I went for it and was not disappointed! It's a great bed, and it's surprisingly high when inflated. It's incredibly comfortable though, the only complaint I have is that it doesn't fold back down very well, which in the grand scheme of things isn't a big deal. It will deflate a little bit over night but not enough to return. I have scoured that damn bed and I can't find any leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Watson

customer_reviews.title: Best inflatable bed!
customer_reviews.text: Built in air system make it quick and easy to inflate and deflate bed. Top is a soft material. Obviously it still feels like an aid bed but the height makes a difference! I prefer this over sleeping close to the floor. The height makes it feel like a bed. I've had many guests over and use the bed with no complaints. 3 people have slept on it before. Great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Miriam R

customer_reviews.title: Faulty - motor blew out
customer_reviews.text: Intex is supposed to be great, but Ive had only problems. The first time I tried to blow up the mattress the motor blew out. This is the second time Ive ordered and the same thing happened. The first mattress I ordered it worked about 10 times and then blew out. The most recent mattress it blew out the first time it was inflating. Im extremely disappointed in the quality and would like to exchange my product, as I am only 4 days past return and didnt use it until 6 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Possibly a Hit or Miss
customer_reviews.text: We used the bed multiple times. After a few uses the material should've stretched to where we no longer lost air. However, that was not the case. We would wake up rolled towards the middle of the bed which made for a terrible nights sleep. After about 15-20 uses we started to get a slow leak. One morning we woke up on the floor. Customer service handled the situation easily and quickly by issuing a full refund. The mattress has a nicely raised height, it inflates quickly, and has a nice appearance. It is just not the most comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MARY CAMPBELL

customer_reviews.title: The bed only lasted 2 weeks and developed a slow leak.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know how that happened, but I wanted to return it. The last day I could return it gave me only 1 week.. There is no way that is enough time to test something out and then the return date didn't give you enough time to be able to get your money back. That is not right! If you need enough time to return a faulty product, don't buy it at Amazon. Go to a department store where you can return it if you have the receipt. Very upset I got stuck with a faulty product that I needed to have.
customer_reviews.author: erose

customer_reviews.title: Love this air mattress
customer_reviews.text: Love this air mattress!! First one we've had that has the built in air pump and can't believe how much quicker and easier it makes using the mattress! What a great feature! You won't need to waste any time looking for a "misplaced" (separate) air pump!!
customer_reviews.author: Traci Lihn

customer_reviews.title: A worthy inflatable mattress
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the rare occasions where guests outnumber guest rooms and for use during our kids' sleepovers, and it's worth the money. After 2 years, it's still going strong and has even withstood our large dogs climbing on it. Took off a star because you do have to add air daily if it's being used for more than one night, but setup, adding air, and takedown are very easy and quick. It's also pretty comfortable for an inflatable mattress; it's had many uses and so far zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: MKG

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second such air mattress that I have purchased. The first one worked great. I used it for camping and for when I needed an extra bed. My son ended up putting a hole in my first one so of course I replaced it with the exact same one. Well I did not pull it out of the box and use it until yesterday. It filled perfectly but this morning is was partially deflated so there is some sort of small leak in it. I tried to return it but it has been past the 30 days purchased. Not happy at all. I guess leason learned the hard way to open boxes and try things asap.
customer_reviews.author: Bleum00n812

customer_reviews.title: What fills up, does not fill up again! Dissapointing, when you think you are doing the right thing!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter, who was heading to Northern AZ University (NAU), her first appartment. I did not have a lot of money for a bed, so this looked good viable option, but it was not. The pump no longer works, can't get air into it, She weights 98 Lbs, and sleeps by herself. Of course the box is gone. Maybe we can make it into a shower curtain? I would not call this a "air bed", Think hard on this option! I feel as is if a just got a degree from NAU and Intex on sleep deprevation. Save your money, get a real bed!
customer_reviews.author: DSD

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for our week long camping trip
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable for our week long camping trip. Only has to reinflate once and it wasn’t super deflated when we decided to add more air. We could have made it the whole week without reinflating. No issues with holes or pump. Has a nice little pocket to tuck the cord into so it’s not exposed when not in use. Our other air mattress didn’t have this feature.
customer_reviews.author: paigeanna

customer_reviews.title: This Air Mattress is great ......My second one.
customer_reviews.text: I had one for several years and just used it when travelling, but it was destroyed by kiddo's visiting. I purchased another one because it is the best air mattress I have ever had. If you are having trouble sleeping and or getting comfortable on a regular mattress, this air mattress is definitely the answer. I have slept on it for about 2 months straight and haven't been sore once when I get up in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price, but not amazing
customer_reviews.text: I work remotely most of the time for a property management firm, but when I have to travel to the main office, I stay in one of the vacant apartments, so we purchased this bed. Its inflation was its selling point and that is much more convenient than others. Without a mattress pad on this bed, though, I don’t think I’d sleep at all—and it does tend to lose air throughout the night, even with just an average size woman and an 8 pound dog on it. I’d say for the price, it’s okay, but not stellar.
customer_reviews.author: GoettlSA01

customer_reviews.title: Feels temporarily  like a Great product
customer_reviews.text: Was about to write a great review for this bed. Pros: Easy to inflate and deflate. -Very handy when guests come home and we are short of beds and space. -The height is good enough and comfortable for us to sleep. Cons: -It's not recommended for camping. It's too big for a camping bed. -- The bed suddenly pops out and there is a huge bulge on the bed and looks very bad. No choice except to throw.
customer_reviews.author: Duo's mom

customer_reviews.title: Pass....
customer_reviews.text: We used this for two weeks as a guest bed. We have not had the beach ball problem yet, but the pump is shoddy and takes a really long time to inflate the bed. The pump also does not work in the reverse mode to deflate. We owned an air bed a few years ago that had an automatic pump built in that kept the bed inflated as it stretched and /or lost air, this bed really, really needs this feature. We will not buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: JOAT

customer_reviews.title: FIts the Need Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: Works great, for our purposes. Replaced old sagging conventional mattress set in a vacation home. We have had more expensive "sleep number" type beds for many years, and love them. This was a trial to see the differences. Sleeps great; just be prepared to order larger sheets to fit the since you are covering more than just a standard mattress height. If we can use it for two seasons, we are still WAY ahead of the hassle and costs of dealing with mattress/box springs. We pushed right up against a rattan head board, and it looks like a regular bed when covered.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Really Big!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the queen size and it's really big! It's actually so big that it made me laugh because I had hoped to use it for camping and I think it's going to take up the entire tent. It inflates beautifully with the built in air pump (electric) and is really easy to deflate, roll up, and store inside the bag it comes with. If you're thinking of buying one for use inside the house for guests, it's a great air mattress and your guests will be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this air mattress. My wife purchased this air mattress 7 months ago. We have used the mattress a handful of times when my nieces and nephews come to visit. The mattress had a bulge after the second use and one leak. I patched the leak and on the next use it had two different leaks. The mattress looks good but it is poorly constructed. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Turner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this bed - not at all a quality product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this queen bed for my son & his wife and 2 single beds of the same model for their two children. They were great for about 10 weeks, after which each single bed began to loose air and needed to be re-inflated often sometimes in the middle of the night - at least they were usable for a bit longer. But on the queen bed one of the seams split causing a huge bulge in the bed making it unusable. I've read some of the "one star" ratings for this bed and many have had the same issue. I would absolutely not recommend these beds - not worth the money and certainly not the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Steele

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this airbed to use at a Mall Lock-In with Girl Scouts. My daughter and I slept on it. So far we have only used it the one time. I was surprised how comfortable this bed is. I expected to wake up with a sore neck or back. I didn't. The only thing that was weird was sitting on the edge of the bed. There is no support there so if you're not all of the way on the edge of the bed, you're in the floor. We are going to be using this bed when we camp this summer. I don't expect it to last forever but it seems like it will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: AleshaJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Air Every Time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost a year ago for camping and guest sleeping arrangements. I love the size of it and how high it is off the ground but every morning after using it about half the air was gone from it. I read that it could take a few uses to stretch the material out so I waited and used it a few more times over the past several months and it still continues to lose air. I haven't been able to find a leak to patch yet but I hope to find some solution. It would be a great mattress if it was able to hold air.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: December 27, 2016 I purchased this product in July, 2016 and initially responded with a positive review. But, now after approximately 5 months later, my opinion has changed dramatically. We visit Grandchildren quite often and now cannot sleep through the night with the mattress completely inflated. By morning, we roll into each other in the middle about 6 inches lower that we started out at bedtime. Has Amazon investigated new suppliers with different designs to hold the pressure? My wife and I aren't overweight, either. We weigh approximated 135 pounds each. Can I return the mattress for a credit? Bob Archibald
customer_reviews.author: BobA

customer_reviews.title: Internal Seam Ripped After Month of Use
customer_reviews.text: Early one morning a seam gave out, making a horrendous noise & bouncing everything on the mattress. It is still sleepable, as the seam was internal and on one edge. UPDATE: second seam ripped and now it's not useable. Amazon says it's past the window, and SquareTrade will not honor the warranty I paid for as it is too new! Don't buy a SoundAsleep either! Not worth the $
customer_reviews.author: BoilerMedMan

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend due to leaks
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted to like this product. The first one got a leak within the first year, but we thought we'd try another. The replacement popped a leak on the second use. We're not rough with the product--we just had someone sleep on it, then we folded it up for storage, later unpacked it, inflated it, and.... an hour later is significantly deflated. Having the pump and cord all in the unit is a brilliant idea. When it's inflated, it's a wonderful product. Just don't buy this expecting to use it many times. We can't in good faith recommend this product to you.
customer_reviews.author: Andy K.

customer_reviews.title: would rather sleep on a couch
customer_reviews.text: I've owned it for about a month and it will not hold air. Can not find the leak, I tried squirting some water around the mattress to look for air bubbles.. Instructions said it would stretch for about a week, but I have to refill it in the middle of the night if I want it to stay firm. Even if I sleep with it on the plush/soft mode it will continue to leak air. Also, went to fill it up the other night and two of the air rib chambers broke, so now it's uneven in the middle. I actually think this is an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Austintacious

customer_reviews.title: Says to remember it needs to stretch
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out first night. Woke up on the floor. Apparently the material needs to stretch a few nights. Needed it that night but material is strong and seems well made. I need to let mine stretch out a bit more. Very comfortable I’ll be glad when mine stretches all the way. I don’t use it much so those using often shall enjoy. The height is wonderful. Just wait out the stretching period. Very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Shaunna HAmilton

customer_reviews.title: Good guest bed for a reasonable price and came w ...
customer_reviews.text: Good guest bed for a reasonable price and came w a handy tote bag. Keep your kitty away tho. altho sturdy. I'm looking for a patch kit (available at Walmart if ur in a hurry). knew the demensions but was happily surprised wen I inflated it. very high. comfortable and didn't leak air even w my 200 lb son on it. fines is adjustable. another plus. cost less than the sheets!
customer_reviews.author: DOBrien

customer_reviews.title: ... was really surprise an air mattress can behave so good, its firm
customer_reviews.text: wow i had family staying with me for a couple of week i ended sleeping in this and just need to say it was really surprise an air mattress can behave so good, its firm , its comfortable, its worthy to have it, easy to set it up, perfect high, none of my guests that sleep in there complained, they also felt surprise and they are asking to buy one for their own houses....so ended giving them the details where and how to get it.....
customer_reviews.author: SALIGU

customer_reviews.title: Mattress Mountain...
customer_reviews.text: Although the mattress worked well for a few months, other than having to occasionally re-inflate to the firmness I prefer, that all ended a few days ago. What was once a firm, flat, surface is now a surface with a hug speed bump in the middle. After checking some of the previous reviews I see this isn't that uncommon for this particular mattress. While the mattress can still be used, it will require climbing gear to get from one side to the other. Oh, well, back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for extra sleeping room when granddaughters visited. They don't weigh much. Only used like 4 times and now it no longer holds air. They are on the floor in the morning. Things should last more than a year. They just slept on it, no rough play.
customer_reviews.author: spence

customer_reviews.title: The bed seemed wonderful when it came out the box but after 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: The bed seemed wonderful when it came out the box but after 5 usages it refused to hold air and had no punctures what-so-ever. I wanted to love this bed but while the design was good and the feel for the 4 night was lovely...I have to say I am now disappointed. I suggest that if you are looking for something sturdy for more than a week, that you look elsewhere. The consistency of this company seems to be a matter that bothers everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sims

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I actually have 3 of these and I love them. I did have issues with one not staying inflated and Amazon quickly replaced it for me. The new one along with the other two are great. They are so comfortable and I love the built-in air pump. They inflate and deflate so easily. I gave one to my mom and she has back problems and loved it because she can keep it firm enough for her back. I have had lots of air beds in the past and none have been as comfortable and easy to use as this Intex one. The price is good as well. I would recommend this air mattress to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: MamaDink

customer_reviews.title: Lasts long enough to get you past the 30 day return
customer_reviews.text: I used the product per the instructions assuming all the bad reviews had to do with overfilling it. This isn't the case I even made sure to underfill it by a bit since I like a bit softer bed. I used it with my 18-month-old a combined weight of 145lbs between the two of us and after the third use, the seam separated in one of the corners and the entire thing deflated in minutes. There isn't a warranty. The built in pump is amazing I just wish the rest of the material was as high quality.
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction failed after a handful of uses
customer_reviews.text: Ive had mine for a few years but its only been used a handful of times when guests come over. The entire seam on the left side split open and now it is basically useless. Do not purchase. Very poor quality. We took great care of it and it failed after just a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: B.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable airbed I've ever purchased. It offers great support even with being double high. I was wary purchasing a bed with a built in pump but it works very well and isn't that loud. I very much like the pump will also deflate the bed. Regular queen sheets fit perfectly however if they're not a deep style they may pull off at the corners at night. Only con would be that the pump must use house current. If I were camping the internal pump is useless but as a spare bed for houseguests this offers tremendous value. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Paul David DeAmicis

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this air mattress
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this air mattress. I previously ordered a twin size, which was fine for me. The queen size seems to make my guests much happier. I have had no complaints from anyone who has used it. They found it comfortable and it holds the air well. If I had any negative it would be how heavy it is to pack up for me but for the size of it I think that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Capger

customer_reviews.title: This piece of crap has a nice little tag on it (once you ...
customer_reviews.text: This piece of crap has a nice little tag on it (once you open the box and remove packaging) that says "don't worry - it's not losing air, the fabric is just stretching". That is a straight up lie! I put air in this thing at least twice a night because it deflates so bad! The built in pump is convenient - but what good is it if the darn thing collapses twice every night and you can't sleep through because you have to inflate. It's noisy when the electric air pump is on, so you risk waking everyone else in the house up too! Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ballqueenmom

customer_reviews.title: It does the job!
customer_reviews.text: We got this because we moved across the country and knew that we would arrive about a week ahead of our bed. This air mattress worked pretty well: it was comfortable and maintained a decent amount of pressure (to stay inflated) all night long, although we were a little sunken by morning. When we finally got our real bed, we let some overnight guests use it, and they were also happy with it. So it served the purpose, and we recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken C

customer_reviews.title: Terrific air mattress at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a rather amazing air mattress. First, the cost is more than reasonable. Second, it inflates to the height of an actual bed, so there's no getting down on the floor to get into bed. Third, it inflates to the point that it feels like an actual mattress on a real bed. All in all, it's a real winner. I'd highly recommend it for anyone who needs an instant bed to accommodate a guest . . . . unless you don't want them to get TOO comfy and stay too long. In that case, don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Sahlin

customer_reviews.title: The first use was great - we loved the height and the easy inflation
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely hesitant to purchase an air mattress in the first place since they always seem to get a hole; however, after much research I convinced myself that this would work. The first use was great - we loved the height and the easy inflation. But on second use, it deflated overnight, leaving our guest exhausted and annoyed. We have no idea where the hole is and don't even think we should have to patch it right now! Now it's too late to return it, we hate that it doesn't work. DO NOT purchase this product unless you want something that doesn't fulfill its purpose. Horrible purchase that I regret. I will not use Intex ever again.
customer_reviews.author: McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Went flat in a few days and now I can't return it.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I hate that I can't return a flat bed. I bought two for staging my house for sale. They stayed up just fine. My house sold in one day. I moved in one month. I started to use one of the beds to actually sleep on in my new place. That's the one that went flat after 3 nights on it. The other is up for one week now. Not sure if that will stay up. Intex, if you are reading this, please refund me my flat one and I'll change the rating. They are great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Daria T.

product_meta.title: Intex Raised Downy Airbed with Built-in Electric Pump, Queen, Bed Height 22"
product_meta.description:
The Raised Downy Airbed is engineered with dual chamber construction: the lower chamber functions as the box spring form on a traditional bed, providing extra firmness and support while the upper chamber functions as a mattress. It provides the convenience of a portable airbed with the comfort of sleeping on a raised platform. Plush, waterproof flocking covers the mattress top for a luxurious feel to provide a cozy night's sleep. The Raised Downey is equipped with a quality-tested, 20.8-gauge waterproof flocked top, along with 15-gauge vinyl beams and 16-gauge sides and bottom. The resulting surface is comfortable and secure, whether you're sleeping at the in-laws' overcrowded house or setting up a guest bed in the basement.

In addition, the Pillow Rest is remarkably easy to inflate thanks to the built-in, high-powered electric pump; quickly and easily inflate both chambers with the touch of a switch. Then adjust to any level of firmness for the ultimate in comfort. The airbed inflates in about 4 and 3/4 minutes and deflates completely for travel and storage. No more fussing with tiring hand or foot pumps or rummaging through the garage for your detached electric pump. And should the mattress feel a little too soft or firm, you can customize the comfort level with the touch of a button. An indentation on the side helps grip fitted sheets so you can feel comfortable in the bedspread you already have.

Regarding Inflation: Measurements will vary based on the manner in which it is inflated and packaging disclaims “approximate size”. Airbeds are measured from the widest point including the beams (bulges) on the side and off the tallest point from the floor including built-in pillows if applicable. Location, temperature, and humidity will affect the airbed’s firmness. Airbeds will need to be occasionally re-inflated (topped off) to maintain desired firmness when used for more than a few days as vinyl tends to relax over time



AMAZON.COM
Designed for comfort and reliability, this Intex Raised Downy Queen Airbed offers the convenience of a portable airbed with the comfort of sleeping on a raised platform. Plush, waterproof flocking covers the mattress top, and an indentation on the side helps grip fitted sheets. The bed easily inflates and deflates with a high-powered built-in electric pump. It features a dual chamber construction, with the lower chamber functioning as a box spring to provide added firmness and support. It has a 20.8 gauge (.053mm) waterproof flocked top with 15 gauge (0.38mm) vinyl beams and 16 gauge (0.41mm) sides and bottom. 

 This Queen-sized bed measures 60 by 80 inches (measured from bulge to bulge) and rises to 22 inches from the floor. It deflates completely for storage and it includes a duffel bag with shoulder strap. It has a 600 pound weight capacity.
feature_bullets: Inflatable Queen airbed for home use. The sense of loss of pressure is a result of the bed stretching but does not indicate it is defective. Needs to re-inflate the bed again until it fully settles, which usually takes 2-3 nights
High-powered, built-in electric pump for hassle-free inflation and deflation, inflates mattress in just under 5 minutes to the desired firmness
Raised 22 inches from floor with waterproof flocked top with vinyl beams and sturdy construction

Indented sides keep your fitted sheets from slipping and a carry bag is included for easy storage and transport. Inflate only with a low pressure inflator. Do not over inflate. Fill with cold air only
The item is 7.25 x 14.5 x 18 inches and it is 60 x 22 x 80 inches (W x H x L) when inflated

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
